Q​(𝒮t,𝒜​(𝒮t))𝑄subscript𝒮𝑡𝒜subscript𝒮𝑡Q(\mathcal{S}_{t},\mathcal{A}(\mathcal{S}_{t})) Action-value function

references: In this section, we first introduce the network topology of cooperative edge caching in F-RANs. And then, we establish the delay model and the cache replacement model. Finally, we formulate the cooperative caching optimization problem for the system model. For convenience, the notations of some key parameters are presented in Table I.

S4.T2.caption: TABLE II: Parameter Values
S4.T2.table:
Parameter Value Description
η𝜂{\eta} 0.8 the skewness factor
λ𝜆{\lambda} 0.1 the plateau factor
B𝐵B 20 MHz RB bandwidth
Pnsubscript𝑃𝑛P_{n} 1 W transmit power of F-AP n𝑛n for each RB
N0subscript𝑁0N_{0} -174 dBm/Hz noise power spectral density
N𝑁N 10 the number of F-APs
dasubscript𝑑𝑎d_{a} 2 ms the delay of F-APs cooperation
dbsubscript𝑑𝑏d_{b} 10 ms the delay of cloud-F-AP
ς1subscript𝜍1{{\varsigma}_{1}}, ς2subscript𝜍2{{\varsigma}_{2}}, ς3subscript𝜍3{{\varsigma}_{3}} 0.1, 0.2, 0.7 the hyper parameters
α𝛼{{\alpha}} 0.001 the learning rate
γ𝛾\gamma 0.9 the discount factor
references:
The performance of the proposed FRLQ-based cooperative caching policy is evaluated via simulations. We consider a cloud server whose coverage is a circular area with a radius of 500 m. We assume that the content library contains 1000 contents and the size of each content Lfsubscript𝐿𝑓L_{f} is 1 MB. The settings of other parameters are given in Table II.
Dueling DQN consists of a fully connected feedforward neural network in the hidden layer, which is used to construct the prediction network Q𝑄Q and the target network Q^^𝑄\hat{Q}.
